alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Huron; Lorain; Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Richland, Huron, southeastern Seneca, northwestern Ashland, northern Crawford and southern Lorain Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norwalk to Willard to near Sycamore. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norwalk, Shelby, Willard, Wellington, New London, Plymouth, Milan, Wakeman, New Washington, Bloomville, Savannah, Chatfield, Oberlin, Sullivan, Lagrange, Penfield, Pittsfield, Greenwich, Attica and Benton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central, northeastern and northwestern Ohio.
